abstract: When Lawrence Anthony arrived at the Baghdad Zoo just days after the U.S. invasion of Iraq, only 35 of the 650 animals were still alive. Clouds of flies swarmed the dead carcasses, and the remaining lions, tigers and a brown bear were in such bad shape he wanted to shoot them to end their misery. But Mr. Anthony bought donkeys to feed the carnivores and he hunted down a stolen giraffe. (The zoo's other giraffe had been eaten by starving Iraqis.) Mr. Anthony, 61, died last week of a heart attack in Johannesburg.

headline.main: Lawrence Anthony, Baghdad Zoo Savior, Dies at 61
